AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnOne.synopsis: Hostage rallying everyone to do everything to escape
AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnOne.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the first turn of the hostage after freeing them

AD_PrisonerGroup6Nearby.synopsis: A hostage calls for help and tells you how to release her - by pressing the Release button (exact name subject to change).
AD_PrisonerGroup6Nearby.how_to_trigger: Go near S_GLO_IronThrone_Group6_Prisoner1_5377cb38-731d-4582-9396-98529856cdbf and the AD will play automatically

AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnTwo.synopsis: The hostage yells to keep going, as they are getting closer to seeing their families again
AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnTwo.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the second turn after the hostage is freed, if they are still alive

AD_RavengardAfterMizoraAppearDialog.synopsis: Ravengard reacts to being commanded to grovel on the ground.
AD_RavengardAfterMizoraAppearDialog.how_to_trigger: Ravengard says this after the Mizora Appear dialog while he's on the ground.

AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnTwo.synopsis: The hostage yells to keep going, as they are getting closer to seeing their families again
AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnTwo.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the second turn after the hostage is freed, if they are still alive

AD_WyllReactsToFindingOutRavengardIsInIR.synopsis: Avatar or Companion Wyll reacts to Ravengard being held hostage in the IRN.
AD_WyllReactsToFindingOutRavengardIsInIR.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically if Wyll learns Ravengard is held hostage during the Iron Throne situation.

AD_PrisonerGroup6TurnOne.synopsis: Hostage is alone, so says something before heading to board the submersible
AD_PrisonerGroup6TurnOne.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the first turn of the hostage after freeing them

AD_MinscEnteringBanter.synopsis: Minsc enters the new Iron Throne and reacts positively to its location.

PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard.synopsis: The players address seeing Ravengard in the Iron Throne cell.
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard.how_to_trigger: Enter Ravengard's room in the Iron Throne.

AD_WyllReactsToPlayerKillingRavengard.synopsis: Wyll reacts to Ravengard dying while they are escaping.
AD_WyllReactsToPlayerKillingRavengard.how_to_trigger: Wyll Reacts to Ravengard dying while they are in the Iron Throne. This happens only if Ravengard was alive initially and then dies (only if Mizora's pact is broken, if it's kept, Mizora will prevent Ravengard's death).Can happen after the moment of death if Wyll is far away and then comes close to see his dead body.

AD_BeastmasterInSubmersible.synopsis: Narrator saying that the beastmaster is busy and cannot pay attention to you.
AD_BeastmasterInSubmersible.how_to_trigger: Click on the beastmaster if he's inside  the submersible while in the Iron Throne.

AD_PrisonerGroup2Nearby.synopsis: A hostage calls for help from inside the cell.
AD_PrisonerGroup2Nearby.how_to_trigger: Go near prisoner group 2 (S_GLO_IronThrone_Group2_Prisoner1_aede3e82-f02b-4d6c-a92f-e9418b1b0e37) and the AD will play automatically.

Return.synopsis: Outcome dialog for the Iron throne. Major part with Ravengard thanking the player, explaining that the emperor extended their protection to Ravengard, and that Ravengard will wait for them in camp where they can talk again.
Return.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically when you return from the Iron Throne, after the cinematic where the Submersible docks at the Dock Warehouse. Only if Wyll is not present.

Destruction.synopsis: The Iron Throne is seen collapsing under the water pressure. If players managed to escape, they are seen escaping with the submersible.
Destruction.how_to_trigger: Triggers after the countdown finishes or the player leaves with the Submersible.

HastarBiggs.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.
HastarBiggs.how_to_trigger: Speak to Hastar Biggs - S_GLO_IronThrone_Group2_Prisoner2 ec0de12d-4a2f-4683-bb11-91473ec3577c - (37; 39; 70)  in the Dock warehouse after saving them.Quick setup:- Load CTY_Main_A- Use Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 9)- Set Quest Flags and Options -> Act3 (LOW) -> Iron Throne -> Change State -> Back At Docks -> MajoritySaved- Then talk to the NPC

AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath.synopsis: The hostages react to one of the group's death, but resolve to keep going for their sake.
AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically if any one prisoner in the group dies. The others react.Grouped the Group4 and Group5 prisoners together since they are in the same room.

AD_PrisonerGroup5.how_to_trigger: Press the release button (S_IRN_PrisonerGroup5_Lever_77a285e1-8ab7-4e05-bfd8-9014d07d6ea1)  to release the hostage from the torture bed, which will free them and play the AD.

AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath.synopsis: The hostages react to one of the group's death, but resolve to keep going for their sake.
AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically if any one prisoner in the group dies. The others react.

AD_PrisonerGroup6.how_to_trigger: Press the release button (S_IRN_PrisonerGroup6_Lever_4a688d98-cc90-45a7-8140-038004e2f27b)  to release the hostage from the torture bed, which will free them and play the AD.

Santoria.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.
Santoria.how_to_trigger: Speak to Santoria - S_GLO_IronThrone_Group4_Prisoner1 a1831c84-e443-4ba9-95b2-49758d576bf5 - (-9; 37; 19)  in the Dock warehouse after saving them.Quick setup:- Load CTY_Main_A- Use Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 9)- Set Quest Flags and Options -> Act3 (LOW) -> Iron Throne -> Change State -> Back At Docks -> MajoritySaved- Then talk to the NPC

AD_PrisonerGroup5TurnTwo.synopsis: The hostage yells to keep going, as they are getting closer to seeing their families again
AD_PrisonerGroup5TurnTwo.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the second turn after the hostage is freed, if they are still alive

ReturnHostages.synopsis: The hostage thanks the player for saving him and/or the other hostages. He will also beg the player to save their families working in the Steelwatch Foundry, giving them the quest if they don't already have it. If the majority of Iron Throne hostages AND the majority of Steelwatch Foundry hostages are saved, they will aid the player by making Steel Watchers on their side for the final battle. Otherwise they won't.Some variation based on whether the player has already been to the Steelwatch foundry and knows about the Iron Throne hostages, promised to help free the Iron Throne hostages, or doesn't know anything about them.If enough Iron Throne hostages survived, they should hint the player that they might reward them if they save their families. If not enough Iron Throne hostages survived, they should make it clear that the player will not receive any signifacant reward, other than narrative and thanks.If EscapedHostage has died, the dialog will trigger by talking to any one of the other surviving Gondians, but a Narrator will talk instead of all of them, as otherwise the permutations are too many. This will be an edge case, as EscapedHostage is very very likely to survive.
ReturnHostages.how_to_trigger: Talk to S_IRN_EscapingHostage_614ceeec-24a5-4491-98b3-a83ab235f158 after successfully escaping the IronThrone.If he died, talk to any other surviving hostage.

ZumboPumbo.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.
ZumboPumbo.how_to_trigger: Speak to Zumbo Pumbo - S_GLO_IronThrone_Group1_Prisoner1_18991627-0e38-44d0-a8ac-31e1105d5392 in the Dock warehouse after saving them.Quick setup:- Load CTY_Main_A- Use Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 9)- Set Quest Flags and Options -> Act3 (LOW) -> Iron Throne -> Change State -> Back At Docks -> MajoritySaved- Then talk to Zumbo Pumbo

AD_PrisonerGroup5Nearby.synopsis: A tortured hostage screams for help when you go near.
AD_PrisonerGroup5Nearby.how_to_trigger: Go near S_GLO_IronThrone_Group5_Prisoner1_08ed18ea-c679-4845-93ab-a88fe73a2e55 and he will play the AD.

AD_PrisonerGroup1.how_to_trigger: Use the lever (S_IRN_PrisonerGroup1_Lever_e2cbb1ea-7f8e-467a-9736-ce5f5b696299) to unlock the door to Prisoner Group 1, which will free them and play the AD.

CaraleeGrollo.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.
CaraleeGrollo.how_to_trigger: Speak to Caralee Grollo - S_GLO_IronThrone_Group3_Prisoner3 06d864d4-924a-4595-8155-d96df5b5f97e - (40; 39; 52)  in the Dock warehouse after saving them.Quick setup:- Load CTY_Main_A- Use Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 9)- Set Quest Flags and Options -> Act3 (LOW) -> Iron Throne -> Change State -> Back At Docks -> MajoritySaved- Then talk to the NPC

OgroNiggles.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.
OgroNiggles.how_to_trigger: Speak to Ogro Niggles - S_GLO_IronThrone_Group1_Prisoner3 c8b6ebf5-e505-4dbd-bd85-dbf82684cbfb - (-58; 37; 68) in the Dock warehouse after saving them.Quick setup:- Load CTY_Main_A- Use Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 9)- Set Quest Flags and Options -> Act3 (LOW) -> Iron Throne -> Change State -> Back At Docks -> MajoritySaved- Then talk to the NPC

AD_EscapingHostage.synopsis: An escaped hostage escapes from the room they were locked in and shouts to the players to help the others.
AD_EscapingHostage.how_to_trigger: Unlock the door in the first room in the Iron Throne where the ladder is. The hostage inside will be freed and will play this automatically.

EscapingHostage.synopsis: One of the hostages made it out and gives brief information about the Gondian hostages held in the facility and maps the information on the player's map.
EscapingHostage.how_to_trigger: Talk to S_GLO_IronThrone_EscapingHostage_614ceeec-24a5-4491-98b3-a83ab235f158 in the Iron Throne after arriving

ReturnHostagesAlt.synopsis: Brief narrator nodes concluding the hostage rescue situation. Should be treated as an edge case. Can be triggered by clicking on 9 different potential hostages and they can be both male and female.
ReturnHostagesAlt.how_to_trigger: If the main spokesperson is dead after leaving the Iron Throne, but at least one other hostage survived, players can speak to them instead. Can be triggered by clicking on 9 different potential hostages.To trigger, play through the IronThrone by using the DebugBook -> Set Quest Flags and Options -> LOW -> Iron Throne -> StartGameplay. Then follow through the situation and save whichever number of hostages you need.ToDo: Add easier debug ways to trigger this dialog.

MainConsole.synopsis: Interacting with the console just displays camera footage of the hostages locations, focusing on Ravengard if present first, then Omeluum if present, and then the rest of the hostages.The dialog is repeatable and can be accessed during the whole situation.

AD_OmeluumTurnOne.synopsis: Omeluum tells the player he will aid them in saving the rest of the hostages as he joins a bit abruptly in gameplay - this can be a useful tool to ease this
AD_OmeluumTurnOne.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the first turn after Omeluum is freed

AD_PrisonerGroup4.how_to_trigger: Press the release button (S_IRN_PrisonerGroup4_Lever_2624ef80-b02a-4ae7-ac1a-ed0072ec0038)  to release the hostage from the torture bed, which will free them and play the AD.

Arrival.synopsis: Players use the submersible to travel to the Iron Throne submersed building. On the way, spectator guards meet them and trigger the explosives on the upper dome of the facility. With little time before the prison facilities collapse, the players dock with the station, aiming to save the prisoners before it's destroyed.
Arrival.how_to_trigger: Use the Submersible to travel to the Iron Throne, plays automatically at this point.

AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement.synopsis: Obelia Toobin shouts a line to draw the player's attention to her.
AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically after the beastmaster exits the submersible.

OmeluumMindMeld.synopsis: Omeluum mind melds with the player and asks for help and also reveals a mental visualization of the whole facility with indications for locations of hostages and enemies as well as any other useful information.
OmeluumMindMeld.how_to_trigger: After unlocking the hatch through the main console (S_IRN_MainConsole_879e9015-cf35-4f45-a9aa-e2365d486cc6), or by lockpicking it, interact with it to trigger this dialog.

EmperorAD_FinalPhaseWarning.synopsis: Emperor urges players to escape right now.
EmperorAD_FinalPhaseWarning.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when the final phase of the Iron Throne is entered.

Ravengard.synopsis: There's already a bigger conversation before in the IRN_IronThrone_Return dialog, so this is more of a hasmet to direct the players that further conversations will happen in camp.
Ravengard.how_to_trigger: Speak to Ravengard while you're still in the submersible when you get back, before he has left.

AD_EscapingHostageNearby.synopsis: A hostage has locked themselves in the storage room, waiting for a chance to escape. They need someone to press the lever to open the door and scream for help.
AD_EscapingHostageNearby.how_to_trigger: Enter the zone infront of the escaping hostage's locked door. They will play the AD automatically.

AD_PrisonerGroup2.how_to_trigger: Use the lever (S_IRN_PrisonerGroup2_Lever_508c7240-7932-4a42-b5b1-1014485cad69) to free Group 2 and the AD will play

ThindoVintervur.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.

AD_HostageCheerAfterIronThrone.synopsis: One of the hostages cheers for making it out alive.
AD_HostageCheerAfterIronThrone.how_to_trigger: Plays when the submersible returns from the Iron throne.Can play on any hostage that makes it back from the Iron Throne - male or female, human, gnome or halfling.

AD_WyllStartOfCombat.synopsis: Wyll urges the party to find his father.
AD_WyllStartOfCombat.how_to_trigger: Triggers on the first turn when combat starts in the Iron Throne if both Wyll and Ravengard are present in the Iron Throne.

MarlonoRhandle.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.

AD_WyllSeesDeadRavengard.synopsis: Wyll reacts to finding Ravengard dead in his cell.
AD_WyllSeesDeadRavengard.how_to_trigger: Wyll sees Ravengard dead in the Iron Throne. This happens only when the Mizora Pact scene has never played and Wyll is a party member and enters the room Ravengard is held in.

AD_OmeluumFreed.synopsis: Omeluum joins the party after he's freed.

DyingGuard.synopsis: A dying baneite guard reveals some information about the facility and tells you to save the hostages before drawing his last breath.
DyingGuard.how_to_trigger: Speak to the dying guard at the start of IRN_Main_A

AD_OgroHittingDoor.synopsis: Every time he hits the doors each turn he will say a different line. Lines are played from top to bottom. If the final two turns have started, he will only be able to say the final two lines.
AD_OgroHittingDoor.how_to_trigger: Plays when S_GLO_IronThrone_Group1_Prisoner3_c8b6ebf5-e505-4dbd-bd85-dbf82684cbfb hits the closed corridor doors while he's escaping.

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath.synopsis: The hostages react to one of the group's death, but resolve to keep going for their sake.
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically if any one prisoner in the group dies. The others react.

AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnOne.synopsis: Hostage rallying everyone to do everything to escape
AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnOne.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the first turn of the hostage after freeing them

AD_EscapingHostageCallsOthersOut.synopsis: Obelia calls the rest of the hostages to come out.
AD_EscapingHostageCallsOthersOut.how_to_trigger: Plays after Obelia comes out of the hatch after returning from the Iron Throne and sees that the battle is over. Only plays if the players were confronted by the waveservants.

AD_EscapingHostageInLobby.synopsis: One of the escaping hostages has made it to the lobby and tries to get the player's attention.
AD_EscapingHostageInLobby.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when players arrive in the Iron Throne

AD_PrisonerGroup7Nearby.synopsis: A hostage calls for help and tells you how to release her by pulling a lever

AD_RavengardFreed.synopsis: Ravengard joins the party after he's freed.

Omeluum.synopsis: Omeluum thanks the player for saving him and then tells them that he will aid them in the final battle. He will return to his Society of Brilliance group meanwhile.

AD_MizoraHelpsRavengardTeleportedToSub.synopsis: Mizora final comment that she saved Ravengard and that she will bring him to the submersible.

AD_PrisonerGroup4TurnOne.synopsis: Hostage rallying everyone to do everything to escape

She then mentions  that she will summono some spiders as well and leaves.If players somehow cured the Infernal charms from Ravengard, she has an alternative branch where she only summons the spiders.
MizoraAppears.how_to_trigger: Triggers if Wyll broke his pact with Mizora and then went to the Iron Throne to save Ravengard. As soon as players free Ravengard and move him out of his cell to the middle of the room, this dialog will play.

PAD_StuckDoors.how_to_trigger: Plays if the player tries to open or close any of the havy doors in the Iron Throne corridors.

FeatherweightFalson.synopsis: One of the hostages thanks you for saving them from the Iron Throne. One-liner dialog.

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor.how_to_trigger: Plays when S_GLO_IronThrone_Group2_Prisoner1_aede3e82-f02b-4d6c-a92f-e9418b1b0e37 hits the closed corridor doors while he's escaping.

AD_PrisonerGroup1Nearby.synopsis: A hostage calls for help from inside the cell
AD_PrisonerGroup1Nearby.how_to_trigger: Go near S_GLO_IronThrone_Group1_Prisoner1_18991627-0e38-44d0-a8ac-31e1105d5392 and the AD will play automatically

AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnOne_0.speaker: Deedle Ofran
AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnOne_0.text: Bloody 'ells, this is it! Go go GO!

AD_PrisonerGroup6Nearby_0.speaker: Flansy Thornwhist
AD_PrisonerGroup6Nearby_0.text: Gods... It hurts so m- WAIT! YOU! PLEASE - THE LEVER!

AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnTwo_0.speaker: Marlono Rhandle
AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnTwo_0.text: Just a little more to go... Come on...
AD_PrisonerGroup3TurnTwo_0.context: NodeContext: running for your life to escape death

AD_RavengardAfterMizoraAppearDialog_0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_RavengardAfterMizoraAppearDialog_0.context: NodeContext: Still confused, suffering from the after-effects of mind control

AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnTwo_0.speaker: Ceres Olsin
AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnTwo_0.text: Quick, we're nearly there! We can make it!

AD_WyllReactsToFindingOutRavengardIsInIR.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllReactsToFindingOutRavengardIsInIR.text: Hells - our time is short. My father is here, and by the living gods, I will free him.

AD_PrisonerGroup6TurnOne_0.speaker: Flansy Thornwhist
AD_PrisonerGroup6TurnOne_0.text: Go! Run! I can make it!

AD_MinscEnteringBanter_0.speaker: Minsc
AD_MinscEnteringBanter_0.text: The Iron Throne building. Plunked into the waters like the great festering turd that it is.
AD_MinscEnteringBanter_0.context: NodeContext: Minsc has just realized we stand in the underwater Iron Throne building from BG1. He battled through these halls once before and is glad to see the place has been sunk.

PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_3.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_3.text: The duke's still alive? Hold on, I'm coming!

PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_4.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_4.text: Duke Ravengard? Hold on, I'm coming!

PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_2.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_2.context: NodeContext: Suffering the effects of the tadpole - so not sure what's going, his head is swimming.

PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_1.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_1.text: My head... I don't... I can't...
PAD_PlayersSeeRavengard_1.context: NodeContext: Suffering the effects of the tadpole - so not sure what's going, his head is swimming.

AD_WyllReactsToPlayerKillingRavengard_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllReactsToPlayerKillingRavengard_0.context: NodeContext: Wyll reacts in the moment to his father's death at the player's hands.

AD_BeastmasterInSubmersible_0.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterInSubmersible_0.text: All right, we're good to go.
AD_BeastmasterInSubmersible_0.context:
NodeContext: NOTE: Not for recording. We want to hack this line out of h5a120c40gb42fg454fga490g591437ec224f ("
All right, we're good to go. Say goodbye to Cap and come up the hatch when you're ready."

AD_PrisonerGroup2Nearby_0.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PrisonerGroup2Nearby_0.text: Oi, guv! In here, PLEASE! LET US OUT!

Return_21.speaker: Narrator
Return_21.text: *Calmness greets you as the submersible slows to a halt. Unlike the Iron Throne, you remain intact.*

Return_5.speaker: Narrator
Return_5.text: *The same cannot be said for the Gondian hostages, however.*

Return_11.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Return_11.text: He's tadpoled, but under my protection now, just like you. His mind is his own again.

Return_0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_0.text: I'm... free. In my own mind again, wholly. I will not take it for granted.

Return_15.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_15.text: You have my gratitude, friend - you acted quickly, decisively. No soul who fell here did so in vain. I will honour their sacrifice.

Return_12.speaker: Narrator
Return_12.text: *While the same cannot be said for most of the Gondian hostages, at least one of them survived.*

Return_20.speaker: Narrator
Return_20.text: *The same cannot be said for most of Gortash's hostages.*

Return_22.speaker: Narrator
Return_22.text: *It seems most of the hostages from the Throne share your fate.*

Return_9.speaker: Narrator
Return_9.text: *So, it seems, will the families of all the hostages rescued from the Throne.*

Return_3.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_3.text: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.

Return_10.speaker: Player
Return_10.text: The Absolute's voice has gone silent. It must be a relief.

Return_18.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_18.text: The... the Absolute. Its voice was clear as crystal, beautiful as a nymph's smile. It showed me the darkest lies and convinced me of their truth.

Return_19.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_19.text: To be free is like knowing the sun's warmth on my face for the first time.

Return_16.speaker: Player
Return_16.text: What are you going to do now?

Return_13.speaker: Player
Return_13.text: How did you end up in the Iron Throne?

Return_8.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_8.text: It's where Gortash stores his playthings. His keepsakes. But I am his trinket no longer.

Return_4.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Return_4.text: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.

Destruction_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Iron Throne is collapsing, with a deep glow within it. As one of the wings collapses, the entire place explodes. A perfect circle of light engulfs the Throne, with a rumbling, roiling boom. Eventually, it transitions into an orb of water, the explosion's light making it look like shattered glass, that implodes into a cloud of underwater smoke. (look up Underwater Explosions at 120,000fps for visual ref). The Submersible does not escape in this branch.

Destruction_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Iron Throne is falling apart. Player runs to the escape ladder connecting the Iron Throne to the Submerisble

Destruction_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player continues climbing the escape ladder and boards the Submersible to escape. Other party members encourage them if they're present.

Destruction_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: A winded Omelluum leans against another end side of the submersible, hand clutching his side in pain.

Destruction_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: He notices the player looking at him, and nods towards the submersible's side windows.

Destruction_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: At one of the windows, we see duke ravengard, hands still bound, staring out. as the player takes a step towards him, he startles, then fixes us with a filthy scowl, and moves away as the player moves towards the window.

Destruction_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player step up to the window and stare out. The Iron Throne is collapsing, with a deep glow within it. As one of the wings collapses, the entire place explodes. A perfect circle of light engulfs the Throne, with a rumbling, roiling boom. Eventually, it transitions into an orb of water, the explosion's light making it look like shattered glass, that implodes into a cloud of underwater smoke. (look up Underwater Explosions at 120,000fps for visual ref)

HastarBiggs_0.speaker: Hastar Biggs
HastarBiggs_0.text: It's... it's over, right? There's not more... cutting? Thank Gond.

HastarBiggs_1.speaker: Hastar Biggs
HastarBiggs_1.text: Bastard Grindo... Carpentry could never be good enough for my brother, could it? Just had to work in a Gondian forge.

AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath_0.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath_0.text: I will tell your story, Santoria! Thindo Vintervur will LIVE ON!

AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath_1.speaker: Santoria
AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath_1.text: Is he - yeah. Dead. No use waiting about.
AD_PrisonerGroup4OnDeath_1.context: NodeContext: not as bothered as you might expect

AD_PrisonerGroup5_0.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
AD_PrisonerGroup5_0.text: AHA! Free - but by Gond, we might already be done for!

AD_PrisonerGroup5_1.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
AD_PrisonerGroup5_1.text: AHA! Thindo Vintervur lives to see ANOTHER day!

AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath_0.speaker: Marlono Rhandle
AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath_0.text: Shit, she's dead. Got... to... keep... moving...

AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath_1.speaker: Deedle Ofran
AD_PrisonerGroup3OnDeath_1.text: NO! Damn it... We were so close to getting out.

AD_PrisonerGroup6_0.speaker: Flansy Thornwhist
AD_PrisonerGroup6_0.text: Please... free the others... I'm too weak...
AD_PrisonerGroup6_0.context: NodeContext: pained whisper, she's just been tortured

AD_PrisonerGroup6_1.speaker: Flansy Thornwhist
AD_PrisonerGroup6_1.text: Got to... move quick... Gods it hurts...

Santoria_0.speaker: Santoria
Santoria_0.text: You were so heroic, my word - I can't wait to tell Skorv what happened. Gods I hope he's all right...

Santoria_1.speaker: Santoria
Santoria_1.text: Thanks to you, me and my Skorv might see each other again...

AD_PrisonerGroup5TurnTwo_0.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
AD_PrisonerGroup5TurnTwo_0.text: Thindo Vintervur WILL survive! He WILL!

ReturnHostages_19.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_19.text: I just - I - I can't thank you enough. I was certain that place was to be my cold, wet tomb.

ReturnHostages_12.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_12.text: I just wish I wasn't the only one...

ReturnHostages_9.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_9.text: I just wish more of us had made it through... But mourning can wait.

ReturnHostages_5.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_5.text: We were kept hostage to control our families in the Steel Watch Foundry. To keep them building Gortash's death machines.

ReturnHostages_18.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_18.text: Please. They need to know what happened here.

ReturnHostages_10.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_10.text: They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might. They need to know their loved ones are dead.

ReturnHostages_15.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_15.text: The Gondians in the Steel Watch Foundry are dead. All of them.

ReturnHostages_8.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_8.text: At least you survived. Your father sent me.

ReturnHostages_14.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_14.text: He... he did? Of COURSE he did! I knew it... I knew he would do something...

ReturnHostages_11.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_11.text: How do you think I found you to begin with? Your father sent me.

ReturnHostages_16.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_16.text: All right. I will help the foundry workers rebel.

ReturnHostages_6.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_6.text: I will do everything in my power to help them, you have my word.

ReturnHostages_4.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_4.text: Gond smiles on me this day. Thank you.

ReturnHostages_7.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_7.text: This will help me ruin Gortash. I'll help them rebel.

ReturnHostages_3.speaker: Player
ReturnHostages_3.text: I don't have time for this.

ReturnHostages_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_0.text: Then I... I suppose we're on our own. Again. Gods.

ReturnHostages_1.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_1.text: They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might.

ReturnHostages_13.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_13.text: They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might.

ReturnHostages_23.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_23.text: There were so many of us scattered through that place, to save so many was - it was brilliant. Just brilliant.

ReturnHostages_22.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_22.text: You - you saved us. Saved us all. I thought it impossible, b-but you DID it!

ReturnHostages_21.speaker: Obelia Toobin
ReturnHostages_21.text: Th-thank you again! May Gond's grace guide you!

ZumboPumbo_0.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
ZumboPumbo_0.text: Listen pal, only a special sort could'a done what you did. Thank you.

ZumboPumbo_1.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
ZumboPumbo_1.text: Aye, youse have my gratitude. Truly.

AD_PrisonerGroup5Nearby_0.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
AD_PrisonerGroup5Nearby_0.text: BY THE GODS, AN ALLY! FREE US AT ONCE... please?

AD_PrisonerGroup1_0.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
AD_PrisonerGroup1_0.text: Aye, finally! Let's get a shimmy on, folks, there's not much time.

AD_PrisonerGroup1_1.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
AD_PrisonerGroup1_1.text: Awe, shite - my legs are only wee, I don't know if I'll make it in time!

CaraleeGrollo_0.speaker: Caralee Grollo
CaraleeGrollo_0.text: What they were doing with us was... horrid. Thank you for saving me.

CaraleeGrollo_1.speaker: Caralee Grollo
CaraleeGrollo_1.text: I can't believe they'd use me to control Droo... my poor, sweet wee lad.

OgroNiggles_1.speaker: Ogro Nettles
OgroNiggles_1.text: If only... my Gladiola... was free too.

AD_EscapingHostage_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostage_0.text: Please, save my friends, there's not much time!

EscapingHostage_4.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_4.text: Please - whatever orders Gortash gave you, once the roof collapses, we'll all drown! Including you!
EscapingHostage_4.context: NodeContext: slightly hyperventilating as she's delivering these lines ala a panic attack

EscapingHostage_13.speaker: Player
EscapingHostage_13.text: I'm here to save the Gondian hostages. Where are they?

EscapingHostage_11.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_11.text: Thank you. They're inside, down the hatch. Hurry! Save as many as you can!

EscapingHostage_3.speaker: Player
EscapingHostage_3.text: I'm not with Gortash, I'm here to help.

EscapingHostage_10.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_10.text: There are others... I couldn't help them, but you - please. You've got to help. Save as many as you can!

EscapingHostage_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_0.text: My friends - they're still trapped. The fish folk won't let them leave.

EscapingHostage_8.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_8.text: Please - help them, if you can. Hurry!
EscapingHostage_8.context: NodeContext: sudden clarity of purpose for call to action

EscapingHostage_2.speaker: Player
EscapingHostage_2.text: Get out of here quickly, then!

EscapingHostage_6.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_6.context: NodeContext: relieved to have her life spared, but still wracked by guilt about leaving the others behind

EscapingHostage_12.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_12.text: Please. If you've any conscience, you'll get them out...

EscapingHostage_9.speaker: Obelia Toobin
EscapingHostage_9.text: Do whatever you can, but hurry!

ReturnHostagesAlt_0.speaker: Narrator
ReturnHostagesAlt_0.text: *A Gondian hostage - the one crouched in the corner of the submersible during your escape.*

ReturnHostagesAlt_4.speaker: Narrator
ReturnHostagesAlt_4.text: *Still shaken, they approach you. They thank you for rescuing them, but ask for you to perform one last miracle.*

ReturnHostagesAlt_2.speaker: Narrator
ReturnHostagesAlt_2.text: *Their families are still trapped in the Steel Watch Foundry. Freeing them would allow the Gondians to reunite as a people.*

ReturnHostagesAlt_1.speaker: Narrator
ReturnHostagesAlt_1.text: *If you free their families trapped at the Steel Watch Foundry, they promise you aid in your battle against the Absolute.*

ReturnHostagesAlt_3.speaker: Narrator
ReturnHostagesAlt_3.text: *They do not wait to hear your answer, perhaps scared to hear what it will be. Their mind - what's left of it - is already set on leaving.*

MainConsole_2.speaker: Scrying Eyes
MainConsole_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on the Security Wing, mentioning Ravengard's location

MainConsole_0.speaker: Scrying Eyes
MainConsole_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Omeluum's room

MainConsole_5.speaker: Scrying Eyes
MainConsole_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on the prisoners location in the torture beds

MainConsole_3.speaker: Scrying Eyes
MainConsole_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on the prisoners location in the Power Room

MainConsole_4.speaker: Scrying Eyes
MainConsole_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on the Security Wing, showing Gondian Guests in subtitle only

AD_OmeluumTurnOne_0.speaker: Omeluum
AD_OmeluumTurnOne_0.text: I will aid you as much as I can - but hurry. We have little time.

AD_PrisonerGroup4_0.speaker: Santoria
AD_PrisonerGroup4_0.text: Freedom... finally. My deepest thanks to you.

AD_PrisonerGroup4_1.speaker: Santoria
AD_PrisonerGroup4_1.text: I only hope I can make it out in time... My poor Skorv...

Arrival_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Gortash videocalls]

A Scry Screen within the submersible flickers into life. Gortash, secure in his office, appears. He's angry.|

Arrival_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_41.text: I warned you to stay away once. I don't do second warnings.

Arrival_31.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SUBMERSIBLE FINDS IRON THRONE]

The party travels with the submersible to the underwater Iron Throne building. A lightbeam spotlights the water in front of the submersible, seeing nothing but murky water until the Iron Throne comes into view - a ruined, submerged multi-storey building, topped by new, domed construction.

Arrival_52.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SUBMERSIBLE POWERS DOWN,]

As the party look on the building in wonder, the submersible engines power down and it comes to a stop. The spotlight flickers and then dies, leaving the submersible in darkness. Then the power returns, engines hum, and the spotlight kicks back into life.

Arrival_8.speaker: Black Hand of Bane
Arrival_8.text: Intruders! Lord Gortash's orders were clear, the Iron Throne must be destroyed!

Arrival_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_16.text: Aren't you the intrepid little adventurer. Digging and diving where you don't belong.
Arrival_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Performed to scrying screen - like a video call

Arrival_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_13.text: And I thought we were friends.
Arrival_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Performed to scrying screen - like a video calInternalNodeContext: Only plays if players made a deal with Gortash.

Arrival_50.speaker: Player
Arrival_50.text: I'm here to rescue the hostages, Gortash.
Arrival_50.context: InternalNodeContext: has mission from Steel Watch Foundry

Arrival_47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_47.text: Wrong. Your presence here is the only real threat to their survival.

Arrival_26.speaker: Player
Arrival_26.text: What the hells is this place?

Arrival_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_51.text: The Iron Throne. A ruin from the city's dark past that could become a template for a brighter future.

Arrival_29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_29.text: It is a most useful tool for motivating my Gondian workforce - key to the construction of the Steel Watch that keep the city safe.

Arrival_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_35.text: But like all tools, the moment it ceases to be useful, I will break it. Thanks to your trespassing, that moment may have come.

Arrival_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_19.text: Return to the city, find Orin, and claim her Netherstone as you agreed to do. And then I will forget this transgression.
Arrival_19.context: InternalNodeContext: only if on the quest to kill Orin

Arrival_9.speaker: Narrator
Arrival_9.text: *Your conscience pricks - you did agree to an alliance, after all. But then again, what honour need there be with someone like Gortash?*

Arrival_57.speaker: Narrator
Arrival_57.text: *Your mind turns to the Gondian hostages, bound in fear, their futures hanging by a thread in Gortash's web.*

Arrival_20.speaker: Narrator
Arrival_20.text: *How many people are trapped within? How many lives will be lost?*

Arrival_33.speaker: Narrator
Arrival_33.text: *Not to mention your father. Captured, enthralled. He will surely perish if you do not intervene. His last breath taken as a slave to the Absolute.*

Arrival_10.speaker: Narrator
Arrival_10.text: *And what of Duke Ravengard? Wyll may never forgive you if you abandon his father to this fate.*

Arrival_30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_30.text: That was a mistake. When the corpses start to wash up on the shore, remember - you could have prevented all of this.

Arrival_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: In respone to Gortash pressing the button, a series of explosion errupt around the submerged Iron Throne.

Arrival_27.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SHOWING THE DAMAGE]

The submersible drives onward toward the collapsing Iron Throne, maneuvering its way through the debris. 

The spotlight hits one of the upper levels in which civilian gnomes and humans can be seen inside a glass-walled holding cell, which is already damaged. The submarine pans downard, passing another cell in which Grand Duke Ranvegard can be seen (provided Gortash's coronation already happened). He is calm, despite the chaos, thanks to his tadpole.

Arrival_45.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [DOCKING]

The submarine continues to pan downward through debris-strewn waters, reaching a bay on the topmost level, where it docks with a thunk.

Arrival_37.speaker: Player
Arrival_37.text: Turn the submersible around and retreat.

Arrival_38.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Sub retreats]

The screen goes dark as Gortash salutes sarcastically, and the submersible turns around and heads back to the docks.

Arrival_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_1.text: Return to the docks, or the deaths of everyone inside will be on your conscience.

Arrival_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_22.text: Tsk. You've been spending too much time with young Karlach - it's affecting your manners.

Arrival_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_14.text: And your intelligence. Your presence here is a threat to the survival of the hostages inside the Iron Throne.

Arrival_56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_56.text: Dead, they are no use to me. So I keep them safe, after a fashion.

Arrival_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_48.text: I have prepared for this eventuality, and if you interfere, I will destroy the Iron Throne.

Arrival_25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_25.text: Whyever would I do that? The Iron Throne is their home.

Arrival_24.speaker: Player
Arrival_24.text: Cut the crap, Gortash. I go where I choose, and I'm curious about what's down here.

Arrival_36.speaker: Player
Arrival_36.text: You shouldn't have got mixed up with a Bhaalspawn. I am going to sack you for all you're worth.

Arrival_53.speaker: Player
Arrival_53.text: You're mine to take from, Gortash. I am going to pillage you for all you're worth.

Arrival_21.speaker: Player
Arrival_21.text: Whatever you're hiding down here, I'm going to take it.

Arrival_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_Gortash
Arrival_11.text: Hah! Are you now? Set foot within the Iron Throne and you will die. As will all of the hostages inside.

Arrival_49.speaker: Karlach
Arrival_49.text: Might be facing Gortash sooner than we thought.
Arrival_49.context: NodeContext: Low and angry, expecting him to appear somewhere but she's not sure where.

AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement_0.text: Hey! Please, over here. I've something to ask.

AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement_1.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageAtDockBasement_1.text: Our saviour! Please, I want to ask you something.

OmeluumMindMeld_30.speaker: Narrator
OmeluumMindMeld_30.text: *A cold, suckering wetness grasps at your mind. A voice, familiar to you from the Underdark, wraps itself around your brain.*

OmeluumMindMeld_37.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_37.text: You must act with haste. Duke Ravengard is held within these walls. He must be extracted.

OmeluumMindMeld_11.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_11.text: Normally I would find your people's lust for pleasantries amusing.

OmeluumMindMeld_36.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_36.text: Unfortunately, we have no time. There are many hostages here. Duke Ravengard chief among them. He needs your help.

OmeluumMindMeld_18.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_18.text: Unfortunately, we have no time. The hostages need your help.

OmeluumMindMeld_22.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_22.text: Do not concern yourself with me. The city will be best served if you save Duke Ravengard.

OmeluumMindMeld_21.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_21.text: I am here of my own accord. The hostages are not. Save them first.

OmeluumMindMeld_0.speaker: Player
OmeluumMindMeld_0.text: I want to free the Gondian hostages.

OmeluumMindMeld_16.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_16.text: It is painful to say, but they cannot be your priority. Duke Ravengard MUST be saved. The city needs him.

OmeluumMindMeld_13.speaker: Player
OmeluumMindMeld_13.text: You would let innocents die? Shame on you. I will save everyone, just tell me how.

OmeluumMindMeld_34.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_34.text: I was only trying to secure this city's future... But you are correct. If we can, we should save the hostages too.

OmeluumMindMeld_25.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_25.text: I too feel this choice's... sorrow. But there are but a handful of hostages and Ravengard's survival will save thousands.

OmeluumMindMeld_27.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_27.text: Duke Ravengard is held in the security wing.
OmeluumMindMeld_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see a shot from Ravenguard's perspective, picking up on the desk in front of his cell and the long, green-lit corridor that leads to it

OmeluumMindMeld_7.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_7.text: The hostages are placed throughout this prison. You must stretch your resources thin if you want to secure them all.

OmeluumMindMeld_32.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_32.text: Be careful. There are many hazards. This structure is collapsing.

OmeluumMindMeld_15.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_15.text: Act with speed. Act with efficiency. Good luck.

OmeluumMindMeld_10.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_10.text: Help or not - act quickly, or this Throne will be our tomb.

OmeluumMindMeld_20.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_20.text: You have arrived at an optimal time. Collapse is imminent, and there are hostages in need of aid.

OmeluumMindMeld_33.speaker: Player
OmeluumMindMeld_33.text: How do I get to the hostages?

OmeluumMindMeld_28.speaker: Player
OmeluumMindMeld_28.text: Tell me how to find them.

OmeluumMindMeld_24.speaker: Omeluum
OmeluumMindMeld_24.text: Collateral. A threat to ensure Gortash's Steel Watch grip remains tight on the city.

EmperorAD_FinalPhaseWarning_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_FinalPhaseWarning_0.text: The submersible - you must return there. Now. It's the only way we'll survive this.

Ravengard_0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_0.text: I'll get to your camp. We'll talk there.

AD_EscapingHostageNearby_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageNearby_0.text: Gond's grace! I knew someone would come - please, the lever!

AD_PrisonerGroup2_0.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PrisonerGroup2_0.text: By Gond's grace... Prayer might be our only shot of making it in time.

AD_PrisonerGroup2_1.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PrisonerGroup2_1.text: By Gond, thank you. Thought we was done for...

ThindoVintervur_0.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
ThindoVintervur_0.text: My esteemed compatriot - your act of valour will go down in Gondian HISTORY!

ThindoVintervur_1.speaker: Thindo Vintervur
ThindoVintervur_1.text: Thindo Vintervur will NEVER DIE! HA!

AD_HostageCheerAfterIronThrone_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_IronThrone_EscapedHostages
AD_HostageCheerAfterIronThrone_0.text: Gods... We made it! We actually made it!

AD_WyllStartOfCombat_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllStartOfCombat_0.text: Destroy them, and quickly. We need to find my father!

MarlonoRhandle_0.speaker: Marlono Rhandle
MarlonoRhandle_0.text: My sincerest thanks, friend. I don't know what possessed you to find us in that place, but I am surely glad you did.

MarlonoRhandle_1.speaker: Marlono Rhandle
MarlonoRhandle_1.text: I need to gather my bearings, then find Jheff. My darling Jheff.

AD_HeatDetectorDestroyed_0.speaker: Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector, Heat Detector
AD_HeatDetectorDestroyed_0.context: NodeContext: you're a magi-tech automated tannoy system in an evil mage's lair - the hypenated speech is you malfunctioning

AD_WyllSeesDeadRavengard_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllSeesDeadRavengard_0.text: Father? Gods, no. I'm so sorry...
AD_WyllSeesDeadRavengard_0.context: NodeContext: Wyll reacts to finding his father's body, dead by reasons yet unknown.

FlansyThornwhist_1.speaker: Flansy Thornwhist
FlansyThornwhist_1.text: Why would anyone do something so cruel? So heartless? It hurts...

AD_OmeluumFreed_0.speaker: Omeluum
AD_OmeluumFreed_0.text: We will talk later. Now, we must leave. Quickly.

DyingGuard_12.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_12.text: Gond's gonads... Think I'm done for...
DyingGuard_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see an escaped gondian hostage, half burnt to death writhing on the floor

DyingGuard_17.speaker: Player
DyingGuard_17.text: [STEEL WATCH QUEST] I'm here to save the hostages.

DyingGuard_4.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_4.text: But the others... They're inside. Locked away... The place is falling apart...

DyingGuard_8.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_8.text: |Door burst open... tried to get to... Control Room...|

DyingGuard_18.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_18.text: |Top level... open doors, disable turrets... didn't make it.|

DyingGuard_3.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_3.text: |Only the Sentry system is active: use it to disable turrets [temp]|

DyingGuard_10.speaker: Player
DyingGuard_10.text: How do I find the others?

DyingGuard_2.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_2.text: |Lab cells on every floor... release them...|

DyingGuard_19.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_19.text: Locked in cells... Find the control - ARGH!

DyingGuard_1.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_1.text: |Click on the Debug Signs in their cells [temp]|

DyingGuard_11.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_11.text: |The others kept screaming... Help... The place is falling apart...|

DyingGuard_5.speaker: Player
DyingGuard_5.text: [NO STEEL WATCH QUEST] This place is bizarre - where are we?

DyingGuard_7.speaker: Obelia Toobin
DyingGuard_7.text: It's falling apart... I escaped... Others are... Trapped...

AD_OgroHittingDoor_1.speaker: Ogro Nettles
AD_OgroHittingDoor_1.text: Time be short! Free Ogro... Free us!

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_2.speaker: Ceres Olsin
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_2.text: Hold it together, Ogro. We need to get out of here.

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_1.speaker: Ceres Olsin
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_1.text: Zumbo, we have to get out of here.

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_5.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_5.text: But Ogro... We can't just leave his body...

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_3.speaker: Ceres Olsin
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_3.text: He's dead, we're not. I'm sorry, but we've got to move. NOW.

AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_4.speaker: Ogro Nettles
AD_PrisonerGroup1OnDeath_4.text: No time to grieve. We... must escape.

AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnOne_0.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
AD_PrisonerGroup1TurnOne_0.text: Aye, a chance! Quick, let's get out of here!

AD_EscapingHostageCallsOthersOut_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageCallsOthersOut_0.text: It's over. It's finally over. We're safe!

AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_0.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_0.text: Help the others if you can - they're further in!

AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_1.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_1.text: I knew it, I knew someone would come save us!

AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_2.speaker: Obelia Toobin
AD_EscapingHostageInLobby_2.text: Thank Gond, finally - a way out of here!

AD_PrisonerGroup7Nearby_0.speaker: Caralee Grollo
AD_PrisonerGroup7Nearby_0.text: Hey! Get me out of here... The lever...

AD_MizoraHelpsRavengardTeleportedToSub_I.speaker: Mizora
AD_MizoraHelpsRavengardTeleportedToSub_I.text: Let it be known: a devil always pays her debts.

AD_RavengardFreed_2.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_RavengardFreed_2.text: I saw her... The devil who... who took my son...

AD_RavengardFreed_3.speaker: Wyll
AD_RavengardFreed_3.text: Father, come. I'm getting you out of here.

AD_RavengardFreed_1.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_RavengardFreed_1.text: I saw her... The devil who... who took...
AD_RavengardFreed_1.context: NodeContext: Still confused and under the after-effects of being controlled by the elder brain

AD_RavengardFreed_4.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_RavengardFreed_4.text: It's... it's her. The devil who... who took my son...
AD_RavengardFreed_4.context: NodeContext: Still confused and under the after-effects of being controlled by the elder brain

AD_RavengardFreed_5.speaker: Wyll
AD_RavengardFreed_5.text: Father, come. Mizora's here - we need to get moving.

AD_RavengardFreed_0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_RavengardFreed_0.text: Mizora... She's the one... the one who...
AD_RavengardFreed_0.context: NodeContext: Still confused and under the after-effects of being controlled by the elder brain

Omeluum_1.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_1.text: I will remain at the Society for some time. They will require a lengthy report on my observations here.

Omeluum_3.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_3.text: Your world's air... I never imagined missing its feeling on my skin. Curious.

Omeluum_0.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_0.text: I owe you a great debt, sun child - one I shall repay.

Omeluum_2.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_2.text: When I return to the surface, I will alert my colleagues at the Society. Find me there, and I will offer you what aid I can against this evil.

AD_MizoraHelpsRavengardTeleportedToSub_0.speaker: Mizora
AD_MizoraHelpsRavengardTeleportedToSub_0.text: My my, what a mess. I'll get the duke to the submersible; you can take care of the clutter.

AD_PrisonerGroup4TurnOne_0.speaker: Santoria
AD_PrisonerGroup4TurnOne_0.text: Need to hurry... Get away from these fish freaks...

AD_PrisonerGroup3_0.speaker: Deedle Ofran
AD_PrisonerGroup3_0.text: Bloody hells, thank you! I hope Genshu and Bala are all right...

AD_PrisonerGroup3_1.speaker: Deedle Ofran
AD_PrisonerGroup3_1.text: If I don't make it out in time, tell my siblings I loved them. Please.

AD_PrisonerGroup2TurnOne_0.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PrisonerGroup2TurnOne_0.text: Get running, lads - we might be rid of this shitehole yet!

CeresOlsin_0.speaker: Ceres Olsin
CeresOlsin_0.text: By Gond I'm glad you showed up... Hopefully Frell's not too worried about me.

CeresOlsin_1.speaker: Ceres Olsin
CeresOlsin_1.text: Of course he's going to worry, Frell always worries, Gond help him...

AD_PrisonerGroup7_0.speaker: Caralee Grollo
AD_PrisonerGroup7_0.text: Th-thank you... I thought I was done for...
AD_PrisonerGroup7_0.context: NodeContext: pained whisper, she's just been tortured

AD_PrisonerGroup7_1.speaker: Caralee Grollo
AD_PrisonerGroup7_1.context: NodeContext: pained whisper, she's just been tortured

DeedleOfran_0.speaker: Deedle Ofran
DeedleOfran_0.text: That was 'mazing! Like one of them old hero stories. Thank you.

DeedleOfran_1.speaker: Deedle Ofran
DeedleOfran_1.text: Bala and Genshu will blow a bleedin' gasket when they hear about this. Can't wait to tell 'em.

PhoenixLubbins_0.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
PhoenixLubbins_0.text: Bloody hells... I was a goner for sure - thank you.

PhoenixLubbins_1.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
PhoenixLubbins_1.text: Can't wait to tell my Spanner about all this, he'll never believe it.

MizoraAppears_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: An infernal rune appears on the ground outside of Ravengard's cell and Mizora appears out of it.

MizoraAppears_9.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_9.text: Wyll, my pet. I was hoping you'd bound along.

MizoraAppears_3.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_3.text: Well look who it is. I was hoping you'd bound along.

MizoraAppears_2.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_2.text: A bargain's a bargain. And I've come to see it through.

MizoraAppears_8.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: As Mizora voices her orders, Duke Ravengard kneels for Mizora, following her orders.NodeContext: May-oos FYUR-ee-a.

MizoraAppears_6.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_6.text: Oh, do wipe that frown off your face. This is what you wanted, after all.

MizoraAppears_1.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_1.text: If only Wyll were here to see this. This is what he wanted, after all.

MizoraAppears_7.speaker: Mizora
MizoraAppears_7.text: Now stand back and enjoy the show.
MizoraAppears_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: An infernal rune appears on the ground underneath her. Mizora sinks into it after she delivers her line.

AD_MizoraInterferes_0.speaker: Mizora
AD_MizoraInterferes_0.text: Stay focused. I'll keep daddy duke safe.

AD_WyllReactsToRavengardDying_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllReactsToRavengardDying_0.text: Hells, no! Father, I'm - I'm so sorry...
AD_WyllReactsToRavengardDying_0.context: NodeContext: Wyll reacts in the moment to his father's death, typically because it's the result of his own choice

AD_PrisonerGroup2TurnTwo_0.speaker: Hastar Biggs
AD_PrisonerGroup2TurnTwo_0.text: Keep going! Don't look back, whatever you do!

PAD_StuckDoors_0.speaker: Player
PAD_StuckDoors_0.text: Must be some other way to open this.

PAD_StuckDoors_1.speaker: Player
PAD_StuckDoors_1.text: Door won't budge. Must be a way to open it...

PAD_StuckDoors_2.speaker: Player
PAD_StuckDoors_2.text: Still stuck fast by some mechanism.

FeatherweightFalson_0.speaker: Featherweight Falson
FeatherweightFalson_0.text: Featherweight Falson'll be back in the ring in no time - once my daughter Clore is freed.

FeatherweightFalson_1.speaker: Featherweight Falson
FeatherweightFalson_1.text: If I got me hands on the bastards that got Clore locked up - a quick one-two and BANG. Out like a light.

AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_2.speaker: Hastar Biggs
AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_2.text: There's no time, Falson - save your mourning.

AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_4.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_4.text: Shite! Keep running - we need to get out.

AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_3.speaker: Featherweight Falson
AD_PrisonerGroup2OnDeath_3.text: He's dead, Phoenix. There's no helping him now.

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_0.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_0.text: We're goners if we don't get this door down! Everyone, PUSH!

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_1.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_1.text: It's no use... Damn door won't budge!

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_2.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_2.text: Please, Gond, if there was a time to send a miracle, now would be it!

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_3.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_3.text: Keep trying! It's our only hope!

AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_4.speaker: Phoenix Lubbins
AD_PhoenixHittingDoor_4.text: Keep pushing! This is our last chance before the entire Throne crumbles!

AD_PrisonerGroup1Nearby_0.speaker: Zumbo Pumbo
AD_PrisonerGroup1Nearby_0.text: Oi, youse! Help us out of here, would'ye?
